Package org.arl.fjage

Class FSMBehavior

java.lang.Object
org.arl.fjage.Behavior
org.arl.fjage.FSMBehavior
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Behavior>
public class FSMBehavior extends Behavior
Finite state machine (FSM) behavior. This behavior implements a simple FSM with cyclic behavior-like states.

An example FSM is shown below: 

 FSMBehavior fsm = new FSMBehavior();
 fsm.add(new FSMBehavior.State("state1") {
   public void action() {
     log.info("In State #1");
     setNextState("state2");
   }
 });
 fsm.add(new FSMBehavior.State("state2") {
   public void action() {
     log.info("In State #2");
     terminate();
   }
 });
 agent.add(fsm);

  • Method Details

    • action

      public void action()
      Description copied from class: Behavior
      This method is repeatedly called during the life of a behavior. A behavior may override this to provide appropriate functionality.
      Overrides:
      action in class Behavior

    • done

      public boolean done()
      Description copied from class: Behavior
      This method should return true if the behavior is completed, false otherwise. A behavior should override this.
      Overrides:
      done in class Behavior
      Returns:
      true if behavior is completed, false otherwise.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the FSM. If the FSM is running, the current state is discarded without FSMBehavior.State.onExit() being called. The states added to the FSM are retained.
      Overrides:
      reset in class Behavior
      See Also:
      • Behavior.reset()

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears the FSM states. If the FSM is running, the current state is discarded without FSMBehavior.State.onExit() being called.

    • add

      public void add(FSMBehavior.State state)
      Adds a state to the FSM. The name of the state is taken from the state object. The first state added automatically becomes the initial state that the FSM starts in.
      Parameters:
      state - state behavior.

    • setInitialState

      public void setInitialState(Object name)
      Sets the initial state to start FSM in. If this method is not called, the first state added to the FSM is assumed to be the initial state.
      Parameters:
      name - initial state object or name.

    • setNextState

      public void setNextState(Object name)
      Sets the next state of the FSM.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the state.

    • reenterState

      public void reenterState()
      Request re-entry of the current state in the FSM. This causes the state to be exited, and re-entered.

    • getCurrentState

      public Object getCurrentState()
      Gets the current state name.
      Returns:
      current state name.

    • terminate

      public void terminate()
      Terminates the FSM by setting the next state to be FINAL.

    • trigger

      public void trigger(Object event)
      Trigger an event on the FSM.
      Parameters:
      event - an object naming the event.

    • trigger

      public void trigger(Object event, Object eventInfo)
      Trigger an event on the FSM.
      Parameters:
      event - an object naming the event.
      eventInfo - an object providing extra information on the event.
